ExploreFact.Text: An escape pod launched towards this planet from the Vessel that had malfunctioned in warp.
It seems that the Nomai here were able to escape safely in the end.
I found a cave behind the escape pod. It was suggested that the particularly bright crystal inside could not be used on its own.

RumorFact.Text: Nomai exited the escape pod and began exploring the planet.

ExploreFact.Text: Nomai entered through the gap at the top of the cave to avoid the invisible wall. There was a rod inside.

RumorFact.Text: The escape pod crashed once before crashing somewhere on this planet.
A Nomai named Cumin was in trouble because she was blocked by an invisible wall.

ExploreFact.Text: A palace built with a substance that cannot be seen unless you are holding the rod.
I found a central room that you can't enter unless you can see the red crystal.
I found a symbol that seemed to be the Eye of the Universe. There was a diagram showing that this caused a large loop that caused repeated battles and deaths in the community.

RumorFact.Text: Nomai exited the escape pod and began exploring the planet.

ExploreFact.Text: Traveling near the planet's core is extremely dangerous without a ship.

RumorFact.Text: Nomai exited the escape pod and began exploring the planet.

ExploreFact.Text: The remains of a battlefield littered with the bodies and weapons of inhabitants.

RumorFact.Text: A Nomai named Menth described something as an abyss.
It seems there is still more to this cave.
The king is trying to break the repetition by some means towards the Eye.

ExploreFact.Text: If you touch something like a pedestal under the cannon, something might happen.

RumorFact.Text: A Nomai named Cumin noticed something in the sky.

ExploreFact.Text: The relationships between various things centered around the eye are shown.
Quantum shards and ghost matter crystals were collected here.
Once a Nomai named Menth had been stabbed with the line, now it was stabbed with me.
The problem of the Collector was once solved, centered around a tribe led by a Nomai named Nerine.
It was suggested that there was a relationship between the Collector and the Lingering Chime. The inhabitants learned that a similar event had occurred in the previous universe.
